        Parameters:
        args - external command line arguments
        Throws:
        CliException - unhandled CLI Exception
        See Also:
        printCommandSyntax()

      • getInstance

        public static CliRunner getInstance()
        Returns:
        global cliInstance in current use

        public void run(CliCommandOptions options)
         throws CliException
        Parameters:
        options - CLI invocation options
        Throws:
        CliException

      • getVersions

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getVersions()
        Returns:
        map of module to version for all loaded modules reporting their version; note that the format of the version string is not standardized

      • getInputConsole

        public java.io.InputStream getInputConsole()
        Returns:
        console input stream in current use by CliRunner or null if none is defined currently

      • setInputConsole

        public void setInputConsole(java.io.InputStream newInputConsole)
        Parameters:
        newInputConsole - input stream object to push onto the "stack" of input consoles, and to begin using as the source for console input
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if newInputConsole is null

      • unsetInputConsole

        public void unsetInputConsole(java.io.InputStream oldInputConsole)
                       throws CliRunnerException
        Remove a specified console input object from the input console stack
        Parameters:
        oldInputConsole - input console object that was previously set using setInputConsole()
        Throws:
        CliRunnerException - thrown if attempt to pop last console, or cannot find specified console to unset

      • getMessageConsole

        public java.io.PrintWriter getMessageConsole()
        Returns:
        message console output stream in current use by CliRunner, or null if none is defined currently

      • setMessageConsole

        public void setMessageConsole(java.io.PrintWriter newMessageConsole)
        Parameters:
        newMessageConsole - print writer object to push onto the "stack" of message consoles, and to begin using as the destination for console messages
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if newMessageConsole is null

      • unsetMessageConsole

        public void unsetMessageConsole(java.io.PrintWriter oldMessageConsole)
                         throws CliRunnerException
        Remove a specified console writer from the message console writer stack
        Parameters:
        oldMessageConsole - message console writer that was previously set using setMessageConsole()
        Throws:
        CliRunnerException - thrown if attempt to pop last console, or cannot find specified console to unset

      • getErrorConsole

        public java.io.PrintWriter getErrorConsole()
        Returns:
        error console output stream in current use by CliRunner or null if none is defined currently

      • setErrorConsole

        public void setErrorConsole(java.io.PrintWriter newErrorConsole)
        Parameters:
        newErrorConsole - print writer object to push onto the "stack" of error consoles, and to begin using as the destination for console errors
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if newErrorConsole is null

      • unsetErrorConsole

        public void unsetErrorConsole(java.io.PrintWriter oldErrorConsole)
                       throws CliRunnerException
        Remove a specified console writer from the error console writer stack
        Parameters:
        oldErrorConsole - error console writer that was previously set using setErrorConsole()
        Throws:
        CliRunnerException - thrown if attempt to pop last console, or cannot find specified console to unset

      • loadPlugins

        public void loadPlugins(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> pluginClassSpecIterable)
        Parameters:
        pluginClassSpecIterable - iterable to collection of plugin class specs; each carrying the java class name and optionally the CLI plugin name override for the plugin, in the form: java-plugin-class-name[/CLI-plugin-name-override] NOTE: there is no requirement to load and/or to initialize the plugins in the order they are enumerated by the passed Iterable

      • dispatchCommand

        public void dispatchCommand(java.lang.String userCommandline)
                     throws CliRunnerException
        Parameters:
        userCommandline - user command line
        Throws:
        CliRunnerException - unhandled exception
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if userCommandline is null (among other possible reasons)

      • dispatchCommand

        public void dispatchCommand(java.lang.String[] userCommandTokens)
                     throws CliRunnerException
        Parameters:
        userCommandTokens - tokenized user command line
        Throws:
        CliRunnerException - unhandled exception
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if userCommandTokens is null (among other possible reasons)

      • dispatchCommand

        public void dispatchCommand(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                            java.io.PrintWriter messageWriter,
                            java.io.PrintWriter errorWriter,
                            java.lang.String... commandTokens)
                     throws CliRunnerException
        Parameters:
        inputStream - input stream to "feed" to command as its input (if null, will use existing input stream)
        messageWriter - writer to receive command message output (if null, will use existing message writer)
        errorWriter - writer to receive command error output (if null, will use existing error writer)
        commandTokens - tokenized command string
        Throws:
        CliRunnerException - unhandled exception

      • unloadPlugins

        public void unloadPlugins()
                   throws CliRunnerException
        Unloads all currently loaded plugins from CLI
        Throws:
        CliRunnerException - unhandled exception thrown while unloading plugins
        See Also:
        unloadPlugins(Iterable)

      • unloadPlugins

        public void unloadPlugins(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> pluginNamesIterable)
        Unloads the specified plugin(s) from the CLI
        Parameters:
        pluginNamesIterable - iterable specifying name(s) of plugin(s) to unload

      • getPluginInstance

        public java.lang.Object getPluginInstance(java.lang.String pluginName)
        Parameters:
        pluginName - name of plugin whose instance is being located
        Returns:
        object instance of specified cli plugin

      • getPlugins

        public java.lang.Iterable<CliPluginMetadata> getPlugins()
        Retrieve information about all loaded plugin(s) in the form of a (new) set of map entries. NOTE: it is unsupported behavior for the caller to modify the objects referenced by the entries in the returned set.
        Returns:
        Iterable> copy of "entry set" of internal plugins backing map

      • quit

        public void quit()
        Cause the CLI to quit instead of reading another command

      • isCliDebug

        public boolean isCliDebug()
        Returns:
        true if CLI debug mode is enabled

      • isCliQuit

        public boolean isCliQuit()
        Returns:
        true if CLI debug mode has quit

      • getProperties

        public CliProperties getProperties()
        Returns:
        CLI application properties will not be null

      • getOptions

        public CliCommandOptions getOptions()
        Returns:
        CLI invocation options will not be null
